@sapo_joe: from what I understand x64 requires a lot more hardware power (memory, cpu process speed, vid card), so some of us with computers 3 years old or more still prefer the x86 because of the lighter load.  Also, I read that even if you install x64 OS's or software, ALL hardware involved has to be fully x64 in order for the system to truly utilize x64, which means not only each hardware piece, but also drivers for each piece of hardware.  Otherwise, if not, it's a waste, because even though your computer will have to perform more calculations in order to run an x64 OS, you won't get the benefit.

If I'm mistaken on anything then please correct.

@nilax22: You can get Windows 8 Pro (64bit) here: https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7506213/MICROSOFT.WINDOWS.8.PROFESSIONAL.RTM.X64.ENGLISH.DVD-WZT

@gunduboss: This is newer than Consumer Preview and Developer Preview. This is the RTM (Release To Manufacturing) version.

@aggelosss5: Yes, you can use Windows 2 Go with Windows 8 Enterprise.

@demis1159, @cursed7: You can activate Windows 8 using the guide below.

While in Desktop Mode, right click the bottom left corner. Click "Command Prompt (Admin)". Enter these commands line-by-line:

For Win 8 Enterprise:
slmgr /skms kms-c.no-ip.org:1688
slmgr.vbs -ato

For Win 8 Professional:
slmgr.vbs -ipk NG4HW-VH26C-733KW-K6F98-J8CK4
slmgr /skms kms-c.no-ip.org:1688
slmgr.vbs -ato 

Key to install Media Center(after you've installed Win 8 Pro):
RR3BN-3YY9P-9D7FC-7J4YF-QGJXW
